history.content: When can we know the result of those applications, say before the end of this semester? Also, can we receive a response no matter we are given an offer or have been rejected? The reader and TA commitment influence heavily on our next semester's course and any other activity schedule. If it is possible to let us know any result early(rejected, accepted, or keep waiting), we will really appreciate it!

children.subject: You aren't notified if you're not selected, unless the professor chooses to do so; you're always notified if you get an offer. You could email the professor to ask about your hiring status if you haven't heard anything. Sometimes readers are chosen a few weeks into the semester they're reading for.

When can we know the result of those applications, say before the end of this semester? Also, can we receive a response no matter we are given an offer or have been rejected? The reader and TA commitment influence heavily on our next semester's course and any other activity schedule. If it is possible to let us know any result early(rejected, accepted, or keep waiting), we will really appreciate it!

history.content:
The November 1 deadline was for GSI hiring; We've given a December 15th deadline for Reader applications. We won't be making any final decisions for Readers until January. Ronald is correct in that sometimes we're not able to finish hiring Readers until after the semester starts.  This is due to the hearing final decision by faculty as well as knowing the final enrollment numbers. You can continue to resubmit and edit your applications until then next week and most likely until January when we begin to finalize hires.

Unfortunately our system doesn't allow us to send out emails to people who aren't hired for the position; we only notify people if they have been selected by the instructor.
If we make a change to our reader application and re-submit, will it still have priority from submitting it before the November 1 deadline?
history.subject: Resubmitting Reader Application
